page.title: 05TENTER HOUSE FARM
page.content: 2 people work on the farm, Father and son. The father has lived there since 1939. Most of the cows are fresian. {TENTER HOUSE FARM } The barn which used to be used as the house was built in 1665. The farm has 100 acres to its name. All of which is grassland used for grazingthe 60 milk cows and 40 heiffers. Mr. Battye also keeps beef cattle indoors. He has been here 56 years since his father got the farm from his grandfatherin 1929. In 1958 Mr. Battye recieved the farm from his father. He also keeps 100ewes and lambs plus 30 geese.Mr. battye makes silage not hay. At one time, he kept pigs but gave up. Hr rears cattle and doesn't buy them in. The house is not listed. The farm is 950 feet above sea level. Mr. Battye's 2 sons help on the farm. The milk parlour cost Â£30,000 (cont.)
